intro: Caliphruria subedentata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved caliphruria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated margin. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive central spur. Caliphruria subedentata is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
